page.title: 16Amenities, Wookey-Bleadney
page.content: A survey was conducted in 1983 to compare the amenities in Somerset villages with those which existed in 1966. In the Wookey to Bleadney area there were the following amenities in 1966: a Post Office, food shop, primary school and daily bus service in Wookey; in Henton, a Post Office, food shop and village hall plus a daily bus service; and in Worth, Yarley and Bleadney, only a daily bus service. In 1983 the survey showed that these amenities had been maintained, and in this respect this area has been luckier than villages in many other parts of Somerset. However, there has been a decline in the number of buses which run daily through the area, now only three a day with one extra in the morning, which runs only from Wells to Wookey.
